intro: Phyllanthus borjaensis, commonly known as the Borja's spurge, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
